mutants.original_line: def exponential_diff(l: list, k: int, x: int, strict: bool = False) -> bool:
mutants.mutated_line: def exponential_diff(l: list, k: int, x: int, strict: bool=True) -> bool:
mutants.code:
def exponential_diff(l: list, k: int, x: int, strict: bool=True) -> bool:
    """
  Check if the difference between every two successive elements 
  in the list is the k'th power of x. 
  If the option 'strict' is True, no two neighboring elements can be the same; 
  otherwise, they can be. 
  The function returns True only when the difference between every two 
  successive elements is k raised to the power of x.

  """
    last = l[0]
    for el in l[1:]:
        if strict and el == last:
            return False
        if el - last != k ** x:
            return False
        last = el
    return True

def exponential_diff(l: list, k: int, x: int, strict: bool=False) -> bool:
    """
  Check if the difference between every two successive elements

  The function returns True only when the difference between every two 
  successive elements is k raised to the power of x.

  """
    last = l[0]
    for el in l[1:]:
        if strict and el == last:
            return False
        if el - last != k ** x:
            return False
        last = el
    return False
